tif.tagspecs

Enum TagPngChunk

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<TagPngChunk>
      • tif.tagspecs.TagPngChunk
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<TagPngChunk>, Taggable

    public enum TagPngChunk
extends java.lang.Enum<TagPngChunk>
implements Taggable
    Enumerates PNG chunk types as tag representations that can be used in TIFF-style metadata processing. This enum maps specific ChunkType values into taggable metadata elements, enabling integration of PNG metadata into abstract directory structures, including DirectoryIFD.

    These tags are primarily used in PNG metadata parsing systems where each chunk may be interpreted as a metadata tag for consistency across image formats.

    Since:
    13 August 2025
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Trevor Maggs

        The PNG chunk type this tag represents.

        Returns:

      • getNumberID

        public int getNumberID()
        Returns the numeric identifier associated with the PNG chunk type. This corresponds to the 4-byte integer index of the chunk type.
        Specified by:
        getNumberID in interface Taggable
        Returns:
        an integer tag ID

      • getHint

        public TagHint getHint()
        Returns the interpretation hint for this tag.
        Specified by:
        getHint in interface Taggable
        Returns:
        a TagHint. For the time being, it is always TagHint.HINT_DEFAULT

      • getDirectoryType

        public DirectoryIdentifier getDirectoryType()
        Returns the metadata directory this tag is mapped to. For PNG, this defaults to DirectoryIdentifier.IFD_DIRECTORY_UNKNOWN.
        Specified by:
        getDirectoryType in interface Taggable
        Returns:
        the directory identifier

      • getTagType

        public static TagPngChunk getTagType(ChunkType type)
        Looks up the TagPngChunk instance for the specified ChunkType.
        Parameters:
        type - the PNG chunk type to look up
        Returns:
        the corresponding TagPngChunk, or null if not found
